body.name: Betterway Bamboo Toilet Paper 3 Ply - Sustainable Toilet Tissue - 12 Double Rolls & 360 Sheets Per Roll - Septic Safe - Organic, Plastic Free, Compostable & Biodegradable - FSC Certified
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 6 hrs 13 mins

climatePledgeFriendly.details: The Forest Stewardship Council certified products support responsible forestry, helping keep forests healthy for future generations.

features: ✅ The Softest Bamboo TP w/ 100 Day Risk-Free Guarantee: How soft is it? As soft as bamboo TP gets! In a blind test of top selling sustainable TP brands, 96% of people chose Betterway as their #1 favorite! We are so confident you'll love it that you get 100 days to return it hassle free if you're not completely satisfied.

✅ 57% More Square Feet Per Roll - almost 2X longer than other leading brands with 360 sheets per roll. This is the best value you can find in bamboo toilet paper. Say goodbye to the headache of constantly running out of TP & needing to change the rolls.

✅ 3-Ply Strength, 2X absorption: 3 layers of premium lint free & strong toilet paper with neat-tear technology. With a double-texture weaving pattern, our paper has two sides: smooth for extra comfort & textured grip for the cleanest wipe TP can give you. Find the side that's perfect for you! We're setting a new standard for comfort & cleanliness.

✅ Gentle On Sensitive Skin: This bamboo paper is Unscented & Dye-Free. No more worries about irritation or sensitivity from the chemicals in regular TP brands. Our sustainable toilet paper is made with 100% all natural, non-GMO bamboo.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: *Disclaimer: Responsible Forestry Certified. FSC Certification code: SCS-COC-004945; FSC number: FSC-C121036 ; FSC registration date 05/06/2019, expires: 05/05/2024
*Disclaimer: Responsible Forestry Certified. FSC Certification code: SCS-COC-004945; FSC number: FSC-C121036 ; FSC registration date 05/06/2019, expires: 05/05/2024

16 Million trees are flushed down the toilet every year! It's time we stop wiping with our forests! Forests are fundamental to the health of the planet — and cutting them down is having a huge impact on global warming and life on Earth. Say hello to bamboo: the giant grass that grows super fast and produces a premium toilet paper! Made with 100% organic bamboo from FSC certified groves. Harvesting trees for toilet paper is an invasive process that disrupts biodiversity by damaging entire ecosystems. Our bamboo pulp comes from small, family-owned farms and is hand-harvested. It’s grown naturally without pesticides or fertilizers, processed without harsh chemicals, and shipped plastic-free. Our TP is hypoallergenic, absorbent, and leaves no linty trails on your bum. We know that to create long-lasting change we need a GREAT product - so we made the BEST.Our 3-ply, embossed sheets are silky soft, yet strong and absorbent. We're also BPA-free and made without the use of harsh chemicals, inks, scents, and dyes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of the beat bamboo toilet paper brands.
reviews.reviewText: While on a mission to find toilet paper that was virtually lint free, I turned to bamboo toilet paper. After trying a few popular brands I settled on Reel and used it for a few months. However, while it’s strong and absorbent, it’s not softest and does leave a little lint behind. Since Betterway is extremely popular on Amazon, I decided to give it a try. To my surprise, it’s notably softer than Reel. Of course bamboo toilet paper will never be as soft or cushy as Charmin, but Betterway is absorbent, cleans well, is comfortable to use and is almost lint free. I doubt any toile paper can be totally lint free. Best of all, NO trees are cut down to make it, the rolls are wrapped in pretty paper, and it’s shipped in a cardboard box. No plastic!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: .•°•.•°•.•°💥As Soft as the finest tissue,durable enough to Bear the weight of the whole load!SUSTAINABLE, made from Bambu...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars More than you probably ever want to know about this TP.
reviews.reviewText: Let's start with why I purchased this TP. I purchased 12 regular sized rolls. The giant, soft, fluffy, TP form Costo was shedding paper fuzz that stuck in places where it did not belong, and caused intolerable irritation. After 2 -3 weeks of use, the Betterway TP has eliminated that problem. After having used the giant costco sized packages of TP that filled the trunk of my car, the size of the box and rolls that arrived were shockingly small in comparison. My first thought was that I'm not going to be able to afford it in the long term. The good news is that this TP goes a long way. One bamboo roll lasts as long as two of the giant fluffy paper rolls, but I am using it sparingly. There is a smooth soft side, which is soft enough and sufficiently absorbent. It does break down quickly when wet and holds up better with dabbing rather than wiping. The textured side for messier cleanups reminds me of textured paper towels. It does work better than smooth TP, but it can be rough and uncomfortable, if too much pressure is applied, but the softer side is always an available option. These rolls/sheets are not wide enough for me with my bigger than average behind. The attached photo shows a roll on a standard 5-1/2" wide TP holder that could accommodate another 1.75" in width. One would think that using a longer length would make up the difference, but I find it is more of a challenge than a wider sheet. I do have a septic tank so I was happy to see that it claims it is septic tank safe, and I can see that it breaks down easily. I will continue to buy this unless cost becomes an issue. I do hope that a wider width is available in the future

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐I am thrilled to have discovered Better Way an organic, women-owned bamboo toilet paper brand that has exceeded all expectations! Making the switch to this eco-friendly option has been a game-changer for our household, and here's why:🌿 Sustainability: The commitment to sustainability is evident in every roll. Knowing that I'm using bamboo, a rapidly renewable resource, gives me peace of mind. The environmental impact is significantly reduced compared to traditional toilet papers.🌸 Softness and Quality: I was pleasantly surprised by the luxurious softness of this bamboo toilet paper. It rivals, if not surpasses, the leading brands in terms of comfort. The sheets are sturdy, and a little goes a long way.👩‍🌾 Women-Owned: Supporting a women-owned business was a significant factor in my decision to try Better way. It's inspiring to know that the product I use daily is backed by a female-led team passionate about sustainability.🌐 Minimal Packaging Waste: The minimalistic packaging aligns perfectly with the brand's eco-conscious ethos. Less waste, less impact on the environment – it's a win-win!🌟 Overall Impact: Making the switch to Better Way isn't just about toilet paper; it's a small yet impactful choice toward a greener lifestyle. I feel good about my purchase, knowing it aligns with my values.In summary, Better Way has won my loyalty with their exceptional product and commitment to a sustainable future. I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone looking for a high-quality, eco-friendly alternative in the realm of everyday essentials.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great to use, great for the earth
reviews.reviewText: We use toilet paper every day. To have some sort of good impact on the environment is great. Nice strong quality. Have bought this several times.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the cost!
reviews.reviewText: I have sensitive skin and while it's not as soft as the number 1 tree-destroying paper, it doesn't irritate my skin. It's not as absorbent as number 1 so I use a bit more, and the rolls aren't as big. But it is so worth it to use fast-growing bamboo (some can grow up to 3" a day!). I've been using it for about a year. I tried the 4/roll pack first; now I order the 12 pack.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars NOT Equal to a Double Roll
reviews.reviewText: Positives: Is extremely lint free and is individually wrappedNegatives: Not even close to a double roll as described---tissue count is meaningless because the individual tissues are so tiny; if you need something that is actually soft, then you won't like these; seldom tears straight at perforations; and most of all, this is extremely expensive per roll.I love the lint free part, but the cost of these per roll for the amount of tissue is very disappointing and too costly for me.
Es más resistente que los normales, no se rompe

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent product but their prices have tripled since mid 2021
reviews.reviewText: I've tried a few brands off of Amazon and like the feel of this brand the most. It has a good balance or thickness, strength and softness. No, it's not ever going to be as soft as regular toilet paper, but I find that's better than having too many fibres that can irritate and get stuck on sensitive areas. My only issue is that the prices tripled since I bought my last pack on June 2021 at $24CA and now its $75CA. On their US site its also showing up at ridiculous prices. Has bamboo become scarce? No longer growing? Whaaa happeeeen??Anyway, the branding is amazing too. Had me chuckling at a lot of the puns. Everything from their website to the packaging and down to the end of the roll - just brilliant.

This is a good toilet paper made from bamboo. Totally the future. However it's exceptionally expensive no matter how pretty the roll covers are. And upon closet examination, it's apparent the individual toilet paperpieces, what you tear off, are in fact smaller than usual. So while there are 300 or 360 of these per roll, they've reduced each piece size. I think people should be aware. Good product but way way too expensive.
I found this to be perfect for my RV. Strong & comfortable. Biodegradable doesn’t clog up the system and made from bamboo environmentally friendly.
Love this product. Although it seems a little expensive, you don’t need to use as much as cheaper varieties, so a roll last longer.
